items.content_html:
It said navigator.hid.getDevices() returns all connected devices (which would be a privacy issue).

But luckily navigator.hid.getDevices() only returns a list of devices the website has been granted access to previously.

Supporting details

https://web.dev/hid/#open
items.title: Fix description for `navigator.hid.getDevices()`

items.content_html:

Changed Assignment without declaration to Assignment separated from declaration in Object Destructuring Section

Motivation

Supporting details

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/Destructuring_assignment

items.content_html:
Summary

Parameter changed to uriComponent which can be a string, number, boolean, null, undefined or any other object.

Motivation

Before encoding uriComponent is typecasted to string, using toString method.

Supporting details

const obj1 = false
const obj2 = null

console.log(`${encodeURIComponent(obj1)}`) //false
console.log(typeof `${encodeURIComponent(obj1)}`) //string
console.log(`${encodeURIComponent(obj2)}`) //null
console.log(typeof `${encodeURIComponent(obj2)}`) //string

const obj3 = {
    name:"name",
    path:"learning"
}

console.log(obj3.toString()) //[object Object]
console.log(`${encodeURIComponent(obj3.toString())}`) //%5Bobject%20Object%5D

Ref - https://tc39.es/ecma262/multipage/global-object.html#sec-encodeuricomponent-uricomponent
Similar issue was raised in TypeScript - microsoft/TypeScript#18159

Related issues

Fixes #10093

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Parameter changed to `uriComponent` which can be string, number, boolean, other objects

Summary

Replace a {{event}} macro with a link to HTMLSelectElement/invalid_event.

Motivation

The {{event}} macro in this page produces a link to an event of HTMLInputElement. However this interface (HTMLSelectElement) isn't a derived interface of HTMLInputElement, so it is incorrect.

Supporting details

items.content_html:
Summary

This pull request aims to add a concise example on how to use instancing in WebGL.
Steps required for this to be considered complete:

  • Write initial example code
  • Get and integrate feedback on example code
    Port example code to relevant WebGL 2 API pages

Motivation

Instanced rendering is a way to reduce memory usage and / or enhance application performance and thus improve power consumption, it's often the solution to performance related challenges faced by beginner to intermediate WebGL users.

items.content_html:
Part of #9740

  • Update Attr and the existing children localName, namespaceURI, prefix.
  • Create the missing children name, ownerElement, specified, and value.

Note to the reviewer: one key change is to use a coherent explanation of namespaces. Namespaces are not existing in HTML5 (unlike XHTML, but like former HTML), except for SVG and MathML embedded in pages. This was not explained (and still is fuzzy in Element, but this will be fixed when I deal with this interface).

So a good test is: do you understand my explanations.

I will update spec_url and mdn_url in bcd too. PR mdn/browser-compat-data#13109
items.title: [DOM Reference]Update Attr interface reference and add missing properties

items.content_html:
Page macro removal - part of #3196

The FileSystemFlags is a dictionary, which had a create and an exclusive property that were importing a table from the parent.

What I have done is simply deleted the two sub property docs (and redirected to parent) to delete the page macro.

Why? This is a dictionary, and we plan to remove dictionaries from MDN to where they are used. This is a half way house to that since eventually the sub-pages would be removed anyway. I haven't done the extra step of duplicating the dictionary where it is use yet though. Figured that can wait until the associated work was done in BCD.
items.title: Pagemacro filesystemflags

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting @dependabot rebase.

Dependabot commands and options

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:

  • @dependabot rebase will rebase this PR
  • @dependabot recreate will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
  • @dependabot merge will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot squash and merge will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot cancel merge will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
  • @dependabot reopen will reopen this PR if it is closed
  • @dependabot close will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
  • @dependabot ignore this major version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this minor version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this dependency will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
items.title: Bump ahmadnassri/action-dependabot-auto-merge from 2.4 to 2.6

items.content_html:
Summary

Clarifies that Object is below null in the prototype chain

Motivation

When I first read "Nearly all objects in JavaScript are instances of Object which sits on the top of a prototype chain" (emphasis added), I was confused, because the previous sentence states that null is the final link in prototype chains. I had to open up the browser console and look at {}.proto.proto to see that null is indeed the prototype of Object, rather than this being an exception to null being the final link.

Supporting details

Related issues

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Clarify that Object is below null in the prototype chain

items.content_html:
Fixes #10046

This is intended to improve the hoisting docs, in particular with respect to classes.

It makes some points.

  • Functions definitions are hoisted - ie you can call a function before it is defined. That is because for a function the declaration is the definition, and it is declarations that are hoisted. This differs from variables in which the declaration is where you define the existance/scope of the variable, and the initialization is separate where you say what the reference points to.
  • Function and class expressions are not hoisted. More precisely the expression is evaluated and assigned to a variable - it is the variable that gets hoisted.
  • Classes are hoisted, but not their definition.

NOTE, this is draft because I am still exploring the last part. I accept they are hoisted. But I don't know what that means you can still do. For example a hoisted variable might not be given a default value - but you can still write to it without an error. I think perhaps the class is defined but not initialised - that might mean that you could still assign variables to the object - but I don't think you could access any methods.
items.title: Hoisting docs - clarify class hoisting

items.content_html:
Summary

Add all the reasons due to ill-formed requests that will result in TypeError

Supporting details

There were a total of 36 occurrences of TypeError in the spec. I listed most of them. The remaining are unlikely to occur while calling fetch. Please let me know if they should be included too. These remaining occurrences are-

  1. If chunk is not a Uint8Array object, then set continueAlgorithm to this step: run processBodyError given a TypeError. Ref

  2. If stream is readable, error stream with a TypeError. Ref (Step 19.2.4)

  3. If keepalive is true, then throw a TypeError. Ref (Step 6 #ReadableStream)

  4. If object is disturbed or locked, then throw a TypeError. Ref (Step 6 #ReadableStream)

  5. If inputOrInitBody is non-null and inputOrInitBody’s source is null, then Ref (Step 38.1)

  6. If initBody is null and inputBody is non-null, then: Ref (Step 40.1)

There are some other occurrences too. But they are results of methods of other classes like Header, Request which are not used while calling fetch. For example (including but not limited to)-

  • Header.prototype.delete method.
  • Request constructor (those steps which are guaranteed to be correct while calling fetch)
  • Request.prototype.clone
  • Response.prototype.redirect

There are some other reasons (possibly more than 10), which occurs because of network-error. I have not listed them in this PR. In my opinion, there should be a separate page altogether since there are many reasons which will result in TypeError. Let me know how to proceed further.

Related issues

Fixes #5545

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Add other reasons for `TypeError` that `fetch` throws
